message: Your head moves more than ~25 px from address. Work on a steadier swing center for more repeatable contact.
why: A stable rotation center improves consistent impact and energy transfer.

message: Your X‑factor at the top is modest (<25°). Try to increase shoulder turn relative to pelvis for more coil.
why: Increasing torso–pelvis separation stores elastic energy for speed without overswinging.

message: Large X‑factor (>55°). Ensure flexibility and balance—excess separation can hurt sequencing.
why: More isn’t always better; efficient release timing matters for control.

message: Shoulder turn at top appears under 70°. Complete the shoulder rotation to help power.
why: Adequate rotation improves path control and dynamic loft.

message: Pelvis turn is limited (<35°). Let the hips turn to reduce strain and aid depth.
why: Allowing pelvic rotation supports torso turn and consistent low point.

message: Spine angle rises >6° from address to impact (early extension).
why: Maintaining posture helps low-point control and centered strikes.

message: Very straight lead arm at the top (lag proxy high). Add some arm fold/width balance for a smoother release.
why: A small amount of arm fold aids sequencing; release should occur just before impact.

message: Release occurs relatively late (>160 ms from top). Ensure you’re not holding angle too long.
why: Timely release optimizes speed without stalling the club.

message: Release is very early (<80 ms). Work on retaining angles a bit longer into the downswing.
why: Releasing too early loses speed and can add dynamic loft.

message: Arm-plane varies >10° during downswing. Focus on a more consistent delivery plane.
why: Consistent plane supports predictable face-to-path and contact.

message: Minimal or negative forward lean at impact. Compress irons with slight forward shaft/forearm lean.
why: Dynamic loft and ball-first contact improve flight and spin control.

message: Excessive forward lean (>20°). Watch low launch/low spin; match to club/shot intent.
why: Too much lean reduces dynamic loft and can cause digs/thins.

message: Great stability—very little head sway from address.
why: Stable center correlates with consistent strike.
This range balances power and control for many players.

message: Downswing plane is very consistent (≤6° variance).
why: Predictable plane promotes repeatable path/face at impact.
